intro: Pulassarium leucogyne, commonly known as the white-flowered pulassarium, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant is characterized by its slender stems, narrow leaves, and clusters of small, white, star-shaped flowers. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in shaded forest undergrowth. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
